intro: Prangos papillaris, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in rocky or limestone soils. The plant features showy blue to violet bell-shaped flowers that bloom in summer. Its hairy leaves and stems are characteristic of its name, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Prangos papillaris is typically perennial and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
